titleStmt.title: E. B. Williams to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG11994

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 37th - 76th Regiments Enrolled Militia Primary Source Documents (1861-1866)
msIdentifier.idno: Box 81, Folder 57th Regiment 1861-1864 Commissions and Resignations

body.p:
Keene Ky..
June 26th 1864
To His Excellency
Gov Bramblet
Frankfort Ky
Sir

I am truly sorry that my business arrangments are such as to compell me to ask the acceptance of my Resignation as Capt. of Co. "B" 57th Reg. Ky. Militia. I am about movving from the Dist. and of course cannot act in that capacity -- 1st Lieu,, Samuel Smith has also gone to Idaho leaving two vacancies in this Company.
Hoping that you will Refer this matter to the proper officer in due time and have the vacancies thus occasioned promptly and more Suitably filled

I Remain Yours Respectfully
E.. B.. Williams
Capt. Co. "B" 57th Reg Ky. Militia

57th
57th regt E M Jessamine Co
Keene, June 26th 1864
Williams E B. Capt Co B. 1st Butler
Resigns and states to the Govr his reasons with request that he refers to proper office. Also states that Saml Smith 1st Lieut has gone to Idaho

Ansd page 467 Ltr Bk A
Recd I. G. O. June 30th 1864
